intro: Menisciopsis lakhimpurensis, commonly known as the Lakhimpur menisciopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
